thread.title: Bonds track firmer rand following Fed rate decision | BusinessDay
thread.title_full: Bonds track firmer rand following Fed rate decision | BusinessDay | BDlive

author: Madeleine van Niekerk
title: Bonds track firmer rand following Fed rate decision | BusinessDay
text:
Picture: BUSINESS DAY Related articles Oil prices ease on global economic concerns, Opec inaction Rand extends gains as US rates stay on hold JSE weaker in wake of Fed rate decision SOUTH African bonds were firmer at midday on Friday as the rand gained traction due to a weaker dollar.
The dollar retreated after the US Federal Reserveâ€™s decision on Thursday night to keep interest rates unchanged, boosting emerging market currencies such as the rand.
At 11.45am the benchmark R186 bond was bid at 8.345% and offered at 8.335% from a previous close of 8.480%.
The middle-dated R207 was bid at 7.845% and offered at 7.845% from a previous close of 8.015%.
The Fed decided not to raise short-term interest rates off record lows, citing global economic growth concerns and market volatility.
In a closely watched press conference following a two-day policy meeting, Fed chairwoman Janet Yellen said Fed policymakers had decided to take "a little bit more time to evaluate the likely impacts" of recent market volatility on the US before acting on interest rates, Dow Jones Newswires reported.
